00114 /* libcfs_debug_token2mask() expects the returned
00115  * string in lower-case */
00116 static const char *libcfs_debug_subsys2str(int subsys)
00117 {
00118         static const char *libcfs_debug_subsystems[] = LIBCFS_DEBUG_SUBSYS_NAMES;
00119 
00120         if (subsys >= ARRAY_SIZE(libcfs_debug_subsystems))
00121                 return NULL;
00122 
00123         return libcfs_debug_subsystems[subsys];
00124 }
00125 
00126 /* libcfs_debug_token2mask() expects the returned
00127  * string in lower-case */
00128 static const char *libcfs_debug_dbg2str(int debug)
00129 {
00130         static const char *libcfs_debug_masks[] = LIBCFS_DEBUG_MASKS_NAMES;
00131 
00132         if (debug >= ARRAY_SIZE(libcfs_debug_masks))
00133                 return NULL;
00134 
00135         return libcfs_debug_masks[debug];
00136 }
00137 
00138 int
00139 libcfs_debug_mask2str(char *str, int size, int mask, int is_subsys)
00140 {
00141         const char *(*fn)(int bit) = is_subsys ? libcfs_debug_subsys2str :
00142                                                  libcfs_debug_dbg2str;
00143         int           len = 0;
00144         const char   *token;
00145         int           i;
00146 
00147         if (mask == 0) {                        /* "0" */
00148                 if (size > 0)
00149                         str[0] = '0';
00150                 len = 1;
00151         } else {                                /* space-separated tokens */
00152                 for (i = 0; i < 32; i++) {
00153                         if ((mask & (1 << i)) == 0)
00154                                 continue;
00155 
00156                         token = fn(i);
00157                         if (token == NULL)              /* unused bit */
00158                                 continue;
00159 
00160                         if (len > 0) {                  /* separator? */
00161                                 if (len < size)
00162                                         str[len] = ' ';
00163                                 len++;
00164                         }
00165 
00166                         while (*token != 0) {
00167                                 if (len < size)
00168                                         str[len] = *token;
00169                                 token++;
00170                                 len++;
00171                         }
00172                 }
00173         }
00174 
00175         /* terminate 'str' */
00176         if (len < size)
00177                 str[len] = 0;
00178         else
00179                 str[size - 1] = 0;
00180 
00181         return len;
00182 }
00183 
00184 int
00185 libcfs_debug_str2mask(int *mask, const char *str, int is_subsys)
00186 {
00187         const char *(*fn)(int bit) = is_subsys ? libcfs_debug_subsys2str :
00188                                                  libcfs_debug_dbg2str;
00189         int         m = 0;
00190         int         matched;
00191         int         n;
00192         int         t;
00193 
00194         /* Allow a number for backwards compatibility */
00195 
00196         for (n = strlen(str); n > 0; n--)
00197                 if (!isspace(str[n-1]))
00198                         break;
00199         matched = n;
00200 
00201         if ((t = sscanf(str, "%i%n", &m, &matched)) >= 1 &&
00202             matched == n) {
00203                 /* don't print warning for lctl set_param debug=0 or -1 */
00204                 if (m != 0 && m != -1)
00205                         CWARN("You are trying to use a numerical value for the "
00206                               "mask - this will be deprecated in a future "
00207                               "release.\n");
00208                 *mask = m;
00209                 return 0;
00210         }
00211 
00212         return cfs_str2mask(str, fn, mask, is_subsys ? 0 : D_CANTMASK,
00213                             0xffffffff);
00214 }
00215 
00219 void libcfs_debug_dumplog_internal(void *arg)
00220 {
00221         static time_t last_dump_time;
00222         time_t current_time;
00223         void *journal_info;
00224 
00225         journal_info = current->journal_info;
00226         current->journal_info = NULL;
00227 
00228         current_time = cfs_time_current_sec();
00229 
00230         if (strncmp(libcfs_debug_file_path_arr, "NONE", 4) != 0 &&
00231             current_time > last_dump_time) {
00232                 last_dump_time = current_time;
00233                 snprintf(debug_file_name, sizeof(debug_file_name) - 1,
00234                          "%s.%ld." LPLD, libcfs_debug_file_path_arr,
00235                          current_time, (long_ptr_t)arg);
00236                 printk(KERN_ALERT "LustreError: dumping log to %s\n",
00237                        debug_file_name);
00238                 cfs_tracefile_dump_all_pages(debug_file_name);
00239                 libcfs_run_debug_log_upcall(debug_file_name);
00240         }
00241         current->journal_info = journal_info;
00242 }
00243 
00244 static int libcfs_debug_dumplog_thread(void *arg)
00245 {
00246         libcfs_debug_dumplog_internal(arg);
00247         wake_up(&debug_ctlwq);
00248         return 0;
00249 }
00250 
00251 void libcfs_debug_dumplog(void)
00252 {
00253         wait_queue_t wait;
00254         struct task_struct    *dumper;
00255         ENTRY;
00256 
00257         /* we're being careful to ensure that the kernel thread is
00258          * able to set our state to running as it exits before we
00259          * get to schedule() */
00260         init_waitqueue_entry(&wait, current);
00261         set_current_state(TASK_INTERRUPTIBLE);
00262         add_wait_queue(&debug_ctlwq, &wait);
00263 
00264         dumper = kthread_run(libcfs_debug_dumplog_thread,
00265                              (void *)(long)current_pid(),
00266                              "libcfs_debug_dumper");
00267         if (IS_ERR(dumper))
00268                 printk(KERN_ERR "LustreError: cannot start log dump thread:"
00269                        " %ld\n", PTR_ERR(dumper));
00270         else
00271                 schedule();
00272 
00273         /* be sure to teardown if cfs_create_thread() failed */
00274         remove_wait_queue(&debug_ctlwq, &wait);
00275         set_current_state(TASK_RUNNING);
00276 }
00277 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_debug_dumplog);
00278 
00279 int libcfs_debug_init(unsigned long bufsize)
00280 {
00281         int    rc = 0;
00282         unsigned int max = libcfs_debug_mb;
00283 
00284         init_waitqueue_head(&debug_ctlwq);
00285 
00286         if (libcfs_console_max_delay <= 0 || /* not set by user or */
00287             libcfs_console_min_delay <= 0 || /* set to invalid values */
00288             libcfs_console_min_delay >= libcfs_console_max_delay) {
00289                 libcfs_console_max_delay = CDEBUG_DEFAULT_MAX_DELAY;
00290                 libcfs_console_min_delay = CDEBUG_DEFAULT_MIN_DELAY;
00291         }
00292 
00293         if (libcfs_debug_file_path != NULL) {
00294                 strlcpy(libcfs_debug_file_path_arr,
00295                         libcfs_debug_file_path,
00296                         sizeof(libcfs_debug_file_path_arr));
00297         }
00298 
00299         /* If libcfs_debug_mb is set to an invalid value or uninitialized
00300          * then just make the total buffers smp_num_cpus * TCD_MAX_PAGES */
00301         if (max > cfs_trace_max_debug_mb() || max < num_possible_cpus()) {
00302                 max = TCD_MAX_PAGES;
00303         } else {
00304                 max = (max / num_possible_cpus());
00305                 max = (max << (20 - PAGE_CACHE_SHIFT));
00306         }
00307         rc = cfs_tracefile_init(max);
00308 
00309         if (rc == 0)
00310                 libcfs_register_panic_notifier();
00311 
00312         return rc;
00313 }
00314 
00315 int libcfs_debug_cleanup(void)
00316 {
00317         libcfs_unregister_panic_notifier();
00318         cfs_tracefile_exit();
00319         return 0;
00320 }
00321 
00322 int libcfs_debug_clear_buffer(void)
00323 {
00324         cfs_trace_flush_pages();
00325         return 0;
00326 }
00327 
00328 /* Debug markers, although printed by S_LNET
00329  * should not be be marked as such. */
00330 #undef DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM
00331 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_UNDEFINED
00332 int libcfs_debug_mark_buffer(const char *text)
00333 {
00334         CDEBUG(D_TRACE,"***************************************************\n");
00335         LCONSOLE(D_WARNING, "DEBUG MARKER: %s\n", text);
00336         CDEBUG(D_TRACE,"***************************************************\n");
00337 
00338         return 0;
00339 }
00340 #undef DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM
00341 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LNET
00342 
00343 long libcfs_log_return(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata, long rc)
00344 {
00345         libcfs_debug_msg(msgdata, "Process leaving (rc=%lu : %ld : %lx)\n",
00346                          rc, rc, rc);
00347         return rc;
00348 }
00349 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_log_return);
00350 
00351 void libcfs_log_goto(struct libcfs_debug_msg_data *msgdata, const char *label,
00352                      long_ptr_t rc)
00353 {
00354         libcfs_debug_msg(msgdata, "Process leaving via %s (rc=" LPLU " : " LPLD
00355                          " : " LPLX ")\n", label, (ulong_ptr_t)rc, rc, rc);
00356 }
00357 EXPORT_SYMBOL(libcfs_log_goto);
